intro: Geum urbanum f. typicum, commonly known as wood avens, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in both horticulture and natural ecosystems.
